title: Family Adventure Week
suitableFor: Families with children aged 7 and up who enjoy outdoor activities and are comfortable with moderate physical exertion. Kids need to be tall enough and old enough for the activities
notSuitableFor: Families with very young children (under 5), individuals with significant mobility issues, or those who dislike outdoor activities.

stops.title: Zip World Fforest Coaster
stops.description: Experience the thrill of a gravity-driven toboggan run through the forest. Kids love this!

wetAlt.title: Explore Betws-y-Coed village
wetAlt.description: Browse the shops and cafes in this picturesque village. The Conwy Valley Railway Museum is a good, covered option.

budgetAlt.title: Walk to Swallow Falls
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk to a beautiful waterfall (small entrance fee applies).

stops.title: Hangin' Pizzeria
stops.description: Wood-fired pizzas in a relaxed setting in Betws-y-Coed.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Ogwen
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own sandwiches overlooking the dramatic scenery of Llyn Ogwen.

stops.title: Bounce Below
stops.description: Jump and play on giant trampolines in a disused slate mine. A unique experience!

wetAlt.title: Zip World Llechwedd Deep Mine Tour
wetAlt.description: Learn about the history of slate mining on an underground train tour.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Blaenau Ffestiniog
budgetAlt.description: Wander around the town and visit the Llechwedd Slate Caverns visitor centre (free entry to the shop and cafe).

stops.title: Treks Bunkhouse
stops.description: Comfortable and family-friendly bunkhouse in Ffestiniog, close to many attractions.

budgetAlt.title: The Snowdon Inn (Y Fricsan) Campsite
budgetAlt.description: Camping in Llanberis with basic facilities.

stops.title: Llanberis Path Guided Walk
stops.description: Enjoy an easy ascent of Snowdon via the Llanberis Path with an experienced guide.

wetAlt.title: Visit the National Slate Museum
wetAlt.description: Discover the history of the Welsh slate industry in a fascinating museum. Free entry.

budgetAlt.title: Hike part of the Llanberis Path
budgetAlt.description: Walk as far as you feel comfortable and enjoy the views. No need to go to the summit.

stops.title: Pete's Eats
stops.description: A legendary cafe in Llanberis, famous for its large portions and hearty food, popular with hikers and climbers.

stops.title: Arete Outdoor Centre
stops.description: A well-equipped outdoor centre near Llanberis offering comfortable accommodation and activities.

stops.title: Mountain Biking - MinorTaur
stops.description: Enjoy a family-friendly mountain bike trail at Coed y Brenin. Bike hire available.

wetAlt.title: Coed y Brenin Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Browse the visitor centre and enjoy a hot drink in the cafe.

budgetAlt.title: Walk one of the forest trails
budgetAlt.description: Explore the forest on foot and enjoy the scenery. (Parking fee applies).

stops.title: Cyfyng Falls Cafe
stops.description: A small cafe next to a beautiful waterfall, serving light lunches and snacks.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Coed y Brenin
budgetAlt.description: Plenty of picnic spots near the river.

stops.title: Gorge Walking
stops.description: Scramble up a river gorge, navigating waterfalls and pools with Adventure Britain.

wetAlt.title: Visit Bala Lake Railway
wetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic train ride along the shores of Bala Lake.

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Bala Lake
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a stroll along the shores of the largest natural lake in Wales.

stops.title: Bala Backpackers
stops.description: A friendly hostel in the centre of Bala, close to the lake and local amenities.

budgetAlt.title: Wild Camping near Bala Lake (permit needed)

stops.title: Mountain Biking - Llandegla Forest
stops.description: Explore the trails at Llandegla Forest. Suitable for all skill levels, bike hire available.

wetAlt.title: Visit Ruthin Gaol
wetAlt.description: Step back in time and explore a Victorian prison.

budgetAlt.title: Walk in Llandegla Forest
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a walk through the forest on one of the many trails.

stops.title: Oneplanet Adventure Cafe
stops.description: Cafe at Llandegla Forest serving hot and cold food and drinks.

stops.title: Loggerheads Country Park
stops.description: Beautiful country park offering walks and stunning views. Perfect for a relaxed afternoon.

wetAlt.title: Erddig Hall (National Trust)
wetAlt.description: Visit a grand stately home and gardens.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Loggerheads Country Park
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the walking trails and scenery of the park

stops.title: Platts Farm
stops.description: Campsite/bunkhouse accommodation near Llanfairfechan with stunning views of the coast.

stops.title: Conwy Castle
stops.description: Explore this imposing medieval castle, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

budgetAlt.title: Walk the Conwy Town Walls
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy views of the castle and town for free.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Snowdonia weather can be unpredictable, even in summer. Pack layers and waterproof clothing. Check the forecast before heading out.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy, especially during peak season and weekends. Allow extra time for travel. Parking at popular spots like Pen-y-Pass fills up early.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Book Zip World activities and accommodation well in advance, especially during school holidays. Guided walks also require pre-booking.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A moderate level of fitness is required for the Snowdon hike and gorge walking. Mountain biking trails range in difficulty, so choose one that suits your ability. Very doable for beginner families.
